alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 5:10AM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF TODAY. THE NEXT STORM WILL ARRIVE LATE MONDAY... .Winter weather advisories will end this morning with little to no additional accumulations. Cascade mountains will see light snow through mid morning. The next storm will arrive late Monday and continue through Wednesday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches in the valleys and 1 to 2 feet of snow in the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Worley, Priest River, Mullan, Clark Fork, Athol, Bonners Ferry, Kellogg, Sandpoint, St. Maries, Wallace, Fernwood, Dobson Pass, Osburn, Lookout Pass, Fourth Of July Pass, Coeur d`Alene, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Post Falls, Eastport, Pinehurst, and Hayden. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may impact power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle
